an2.118:0.2: 11. Hopes That Are Hard to Give Up
an2.118:1.1: “These two hopes are hard to give up.
an2.118:1.3: The hope for wealth and the hope for long life.
an2.118:1.4: These are two hopes that are hard to give up.”
an2.119:1.1: “These two people are rare in the world.
an2.119:1.3: One who takes the initiative, and one who is grateful and thankful.
an2.119:1.4: These are the two people who are rare in the world.”
an2.120:1.1: “These two people are rare in the world.
an2.120:1.3: One who is satisfied, and one who satisfies others.
an2.120:1.4: These are the two people who are rare in the world.”
an2.121:1.1: “These two people are hard to satisfy in the world.
an2.121:1.3: One who continually hoards wealth, and one who continually wastes wealth.
an2.121:1.4: These are the two people who are hard to satisfy in the world.”
an2.122:1.1: “These two people are easy to satisfy in the world.
an2.122:1.3: One who does not continually hoard wealth, and one who does not continually waste wealth.
an2.122:1.4: These are the two people who are easy to satisfy in the world.”
an2.123:1.1: “There are two conditions for the arising of greed.
an2.123:1.3: The feature of beauty and improper attention.
an2.123:1.4: These are the two conditions for the arising of greed.”
an2.124:1.1: “There are two conditions for the arising of hate.
an2.124:1.3: The feature of harshness and improper attention.
an2.124:1.4: These are the two conditions for the arising of hate.”
an2.125:1.1: “There are two conditions for the arising of wrong view.
an2.125:1.3: The words of another and improper attention.
an2.125:1.4: These are the two conditions for the arising of wrong view.”
an2.126:1.1: “There are two conditions for the arising of right view.
an2.126:1.3: The words of another and proper attention.
an2.126:1.4: These are the two conditions for the arising of right view.”
an2.127:1.3: A light offense and a serious offense.
an2.128:1.3: An offense with corrupt intention and an offense without corrupt intention.
an2.129:1.3: An offense requiring rehabilitation and an offense not requiring rehabilitation.
